column2: (ED:PT:Admin) Daedric Favour: DISABLED. Enable?

The §YDaedric Favour§! mechanic allows characters (usually players) to pay a significant amount of offmap currency to a Daedric Prince, in exchange for lifelong benefits. (Can always activate their artifacts, can always convert to their religion, can potentially unlock a special bloodline.)

When this mechanic is enabled, all of these features are available.

When this mechanic is disabled, any previously-earned Daedric Favour is recorded and will not be lost, but it cannot be used in any way, and it is impossible to gain any new Daedric Favour.

This mechanic is enabled by default in all new games, and it can ONLY be enabled/disabled in single-player mode.
(ED:PT:Admin) Daedric Favour: ENABLED. Disable?

The §YDaedric Favour§! mechanic allows characters (usually players) to pay a significant amount of offmap currency to a Daedric Prince, in exchange for lifelong benefits. (Can always activate their artifacts, can always convert to their religion, can potentially unlock a special bloodline.)

When this mechanic is enabled, all of these features are available.

When this mechanic is disabled, any previously-earned Daedric Favour is recorded and will not be lost, but it cannot be used in any way, and it is impossible to gain any new Daedric Favour.

This mechanic is enabled by default in all new games, and it can ONLY be enabled/disabled in single-player mode.
The §YDaedric Favour§! mechanic is enabled

Oblivion-Touched Blood

[Root.GetBestName] is known to have made many successful deals with several of the major entities in the planes of Oblivion. This highly-unusual achievement means that those entities have taken an interest in [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and [Root.GetHerHis] descendants...
Any §YDaedric Favour§! gained by any dynasty member will be §Ymerged§! into this bloodline
